answer_en: Yes, that seems like a valid diagnosis based on your symptoms. I would prescribe you the following medications Warfarin, Digoxin, Sotalol, and maybe Amiodarone to regulate your heart rate. You also need Torsemide, Bumetanide, and Dopamine to manage your fluid buildup. You can take Vitamin E to improve your heart health, and Ibandronate to strengthen your bones. Finally, I recommend Flecainide, Dofetilide, and Isosorbide Mononitrate to control your blood pressure and keep it stable.

query_en: Hi doctor, I have been having issues with my vision lately. My eye feels like there is a lot of pressure in it and my peripheral vision seems to be getting worse.
answer_en: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may be experiencing glaucoma. I will be prescribing a medication to help manage it. You will need to use a combination of 'Latanoprost', 'Bimatoprost Ophthalmic', 'Brimonidine Ophthalmic', 'Timolol', 'Travoprost (Travatan)', 'Prednisolone Ophthalmic', 'Brimonidine-Timolol Ophthalmic', 'Dorzolamide Ophthalmic', 'Brinzolamide Ophthalmic', 'Tropicamide Ophthalmic', 'Apraclonidine Ophthalmic', or 'Acetazolamide (Diamox)' depending on what works best for you.

query_en: Doctor, I think I have an eating disorder. I have been experiencing extreme weight loss, and I can't seem to control my eating habits.
answer_en: Okay, I understand your concern. We will need to put you on some medications to treat your eating disorder. query_en: Doctor, I had a transient ischemic attack a few weeks ago and I'm afraid it might happen again. What can I do?
answer_en: Don't worry, we have several medications that can help prevent another attack. query_en: Doctor, I have been experiencing sharp pains in my lower back and a burning sensation while urinating. I think I might have pyelonephritis, what type of medication do I need?
answer_en: The required medication for treating pyelonephritis includes antibiotics such as ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin (Levaquin), ceftriaxone, cefotaxime, or cefixime (Suprax) depending on the severity of the infection. Phenazopyridine (Azo) can also help relieve the burning sensation during urination. In case of any pain, you can use Dihydrocodeine (Didone) and anti-fungal clotrimazole.

query_en: Hi Doctor, I'm experiencing a lot of pain and limited range of motion in my shoulder.
answer_en: It sounds like you may have a rotator cuff injury. I recommend a combination of medications including Triamcinolone Topical Product, Bupivacaine, and Cortisone to help manage the pain and inflammation. We may also use Rocuronium, Sevoflurane, Mepivacaine, Desflurane or Nitrous Oxide as anesthesia during any medical procedures. Additionally, we can prescribe Diclofenac Topical Product to further alleviate your symptoms. However, please note, that Rapacuronium is banned due to the risk of severe side effects.

query_en: Doctor, I have been experiencing chronic pain for some time now. It's unbearable and I can barely get on with my day-to-day activities.
answer_en: I think we should start you on some medications to manage the pain. I'm prescribing you Oxycodone, Methadone, Carisoprodol (Soma), Oxymorphone (Opana), Diclofenac Topical Product, Milnacipran (Savella), Cannabis (Schedule I Substance), Cevimeline (Evoxac), Sorbitol, and Choline. query_en: Doctor, I am pregnant and I have been experiencing a lot of problems lately. Can you suggest any medications that could help me?
answer_en: Yes, I can prescribe you with a Multivitamin and Prenatal supplement to ensure that you receive all the necessary nutrients during your pregnancy. You may also need a Miconazole Topical Product if you experience any fungal infections. Additionally, if you are Rh-negative, you will require Rho(D) immune globulin (Rhogam) to prevent any blood incompatibility issues in your baby. Clomiphene (Clomid) can be prescribed if you have fertility problems. For high blood pressure issues, Methyldopa can be prescribed.
